intro: Thalictrum minutissimum, commonly known as the least meadow-rue, is a delicate flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. Its leaves are compound, with numerous finely divided leaflets, giving it a lacy appearance. Thalictrum minutissimum is often found in meadows and is noted for its early spring bloom.
